title: Deaths from household and outdoor air pollution
subtitle: Total absolute number of deaths from household and outdoor (ambient) air pollution per year. Household pollution-related deaths result from the use of solid fuels (crop wastes, dung, firewood, charcoal and coal) for cooking and heating. Outdoor pollution-related deaths result from disease attributed to exposure to particulate matter (PM) and ozone (Oâ‚ƒ).
sourceDesc: Institute of Health Metrics and Evaluation (IHME)
